StudyObjective: To examine the brain mechanisms involved in gradually learning and subsequently generalizing a set of visual discriminations, exploring whether hippocampal and/or neocortical activity at encoding, retrieval, or both, was associated with generalizations between equivalence classes.

fMRITasks.TaskName: Visual Discrimination Learning and Generalization Task
fMRITasks.TaskDescription: Participants learned a set of visual discriminations via trial-and-error and were subsequently tested on their ability to generalize what they had learned.
fMRITasks.DesignDetails: During scanning, participants engaged in a first-person virtual reality environment where they had to select a rewarded building among two options based on wall texture configurations. Each trial lasted 3 seconds for the selection, followed by 7 seconds of feedback and a 1-second inter-trial interval. There were 48 trials per discrimination presented in a pseudorandom order, and the generalization phase involved 12 test trials.
